result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Omar Terrell Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Omar Terrell Johnson.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Defense advises of joint recommendation for possible resolution and requests an adjourned date for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter.  Defendant shall be produced for next hearing.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Omar Terrell Johnson.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a plea and sentencing date be set.  Defendant to appear via zoom for next hearing date. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 6/14/2022  (18 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.

Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in custody, appearing via video.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for Attorney Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Further discussions put forth on the record regarding Co-Defendant case which has a Scheduling Conference currently set before this court.  Court schedules next court date to follow Co-defendant case.   Defendant shall appear via zoom for next hearing date. 

Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case adjourned due to Prelim not scheduling arraignment by zoom for defendant at Dodge Correctional Institution.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Defense filed request for substitution.  Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am; defense counsel and defendant to appear by zoom.
Request for Substitution of Judge.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in court, appear by video with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by videofor the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 20CF2226. Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer B. Vandenboogard.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense request a arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 17. Date provided by Br. 17 clerk.  Arraignment scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appear by video.  Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness was not present due to witness on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Notice of Motion To Adjourn.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Omar Terrell Johnson in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Omar Terrell Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
